file_content.text: Yes, sir.
So. Havoc Squad. Best of the best.
Can't say I'm thrilled about the demotion, but it's an honor to be here. Sir.
I realize the circumstances weren't ideal, but I'm glad you're with us, Jorgan.
Welcome aboard.
A spot in Havoc was the least they could do.
How are you holding up?
Still angry?
You mean after watching Tavus flush my career down the 'fresher? What do you think.
I just love hearing you say that--"sir." Say it again.
You're in my world now.
Is this really how you want to start things off?
Four years at the academy, seven years in the field, decorations, commendations....
Would've made captain soon if Command hadn't hung me out to dry.
We both know Tavus's defection wasn't your fault.
I agree, that was unfair.
Tell that to the brass when they need a scapegoat.
Maybe if you'd been a little nicer....
You kind of deserved it.
My job was to keep soldiers alive, not pamper them.
I need you thinking about the mission, Jorgan, not your career.
Get over it.
I don't let personal grievances affect my mission performance.
But hey, water under the bridge. Command put me in Havoc to help you find Tavus and I intend to do just that.
I've hunted Imperials from one side of the galaxy to the next. Used to command the Deadeyes--finest sniper squad in the Republic.
I look forward to seeing what you can do, Jorgan.
Glad to hear it.
You won't be disappointed.
I'm not familiar with that outfit.
The Deadeyes?
No? Maybe I'll tell you about them sometime.
That's why I'm putting you in charge of the Wax Hands, my new boot-polishing brigade.
How good are you at cleaning?
So that's how it's going to be. Fine. I've had worse assignments.
You ever think we'll adopt our own litter of runts?
I'd like that. I think you'd make a good father.
I hope so.
Yeah? I think you'd be up to the job, too.
I honestly never gave it much thought.
I don't know.
Really? You should start.
If we do raise any of our own, I'll look forward to showing them around a blaster rifle--when they're old enough, of course.
I'm a soldier. I don't have time for children.
Hadn't planned on it.
That's too bad. You're a born leader--figured you'd be a natural at mothering.
Hope you change your mind someday. I'd like to raise a few of my own, teach them how to handle a blaster--when they're old enough, of course.
Whatever happens, just know that I'll always have your back, sir. I'm a Havoc man to the end.
And you can count on me to train any recruits we might get.
Give me a couple days, I can show any rookie how to handle a rifle properly.
I wasn't sure when would be a good time to bring this up. Figure now is as good as any.
For the Cathar, picking a mate... it's a lifelong commitment. Big decision, as you can imagine.
Never really gave it much thought before. And then I met you.
My people have that, too. It's called "marriage."
It's not just Cathar, silly.
Right. Marriage.
You never thought about settling down?
Why not?
Didn't think I'd live long enough. Few soldiers get a ripe old death.
Couldn't find anyone else stubborn enough to stick with you?
I'm not surprised.
Not like you. You could train a gundark to curtsy if you put your mind to it.
But lately I've been thinking--about you, me, the war, and what'll happen when it's all over.
I've been thinking... I'd like to start a family someday. A family with you.
What are you trying to say?
Huh?
Come on, you're a smart woman, always thinking ten steps ahead of the enemy. You know where this is going.
Aric Jorgan, are you asking me to be your life-mate?
Are you proposing?
I--blast it, woman! I had this all planned out.
But yes--life-mate, wife, however you want to put it, the position's yours... if you want it.
Can you really see me being a housewife?
I'm not sure that fits me.
Not exactly. But as long as you're with me, I'm not real picky.
I love you. Never thought I'd be saying those words, but there it is.
Also never thought I'd meet someone I'd want to spend the rest of my life with, but... well, you're it. So?
Of course I'll marry you!
Yes!
Good answer.
And here I was beginning to think the war was going to end before you proposed.
It's about time you asked.
I'll take that as a "yes."
Soon as we get the chance, we should go on leave, have this done all official-like.
Maybe take a vacation, go someplace quiet--someplace far away from the war. I'm thinking Ithor.
As long as there aren't any Imperials blasting at us, I'll be happy.
Sounds wonderful.
A break from 4X's antics couldn't hurt, either.
I'd like to see your homeworld someday.
What about Cathar?
Cathar? Hmm. Never been there myself, honestly.
Not much left to see, from what I hear. Still... it's a thought.
Think all you want, but I'm looking for a more action-packed honeymoon.
Boring!
You really are crazy. It's not too late for me to back out, is it?
I care about you a lot, Jorgan--but that kind of commitment just isn't for me.
I can't.
Right. I wouldn't want to push you into something you're not ready for.
Excuse me.
I'm only going to say this once, so listen up.
Being a soldier isn't just what I do--it's who I am. And I'm good at it.
But when it comes to women, relationships... that's where things get messy for me.
There aren't exactly a lot of men lining up to woo female commandos, either.
I know how you feel.
And rightfully so, if they know what's good for them.
I can think of a few reasons why that might be....
[Flirt] That's not surprising.
Very funny.
Is there a reason you're telling me all this?
You're not making sense.
I'm getting to that.
Point is, I like you. A lot. I've never met a woman who got me the way you seem to.
You're a good man, Jorgan. I'm lucky to have found you.
I think you're a catch.
Glad you think so.
We're a different breed, you and I.
We've got a lot in common.
All the more reason for us to appreciate what we have.
You've also never met a woman who could put up with you like I do.
You are kind of a jerk.
There's that, too.
I've given up a lot for the Republic, and I'll keep on giving as long as I can.
But for all the rules and regulations telling me otherwise, you're the one thing I'll never give up.
It'll take an army to pry me away from you.
I'm not going anywhere.
Likewise.
I've never heard you talk so openly before.
[Flirt] You're getting soft.
Yeah, yeah. Just don't blab about it.
All right, I think that's enough heartfelt sentiment for one day. Let's get back out there and bag us some Imperials.
We've had some fun, but I don't know that I feel that strongly about you.
Whoa, back off.
Oh. I mean, that's fine. I was just... talking.
Sir.
Sir, I'd like to apologize for my behavior earlier.
When I heard about Trace and Koplin... I just lost it. Would have done something stupid if you hadn't stopped me.
Losing a friend is no easy thing.
I understand how you feel.
I can accept it when a comrade falls in battle. But those men were sold out.
You feeling better now?
You okay?
I don't feel like killing anyone, if that's what you're asking.
Your conduct was unacceptable, soldier.
Don't ever do that again.
It won't happen again, sir.
I'd have been no better than Zane if I'd pulled that trigger.
I'd just be another thug doing whatever it took to get his way.
You're a good soldier, Jorgan. Don't forget that.
You're better than that.
Thank you, sir.
Still, it would have felt good to smack him around a bit.
Zane was scum.
Heh. Yeah. It would've.
Sometimes you have to follow your own path. Like we did when we rescued the Deadeyes.
Can't always follow the rules.
True. But I'd rather not cross that line too often.
There's always going to be men like Zane calling the shots in the Republic. Can't kill all of them.
Better to work with the system than against it.
The Republic needs more soldiers like you. You'll make it to the top someday.
You'll go far.
I can still count on you, right?
So you're with me?
Absolutely, sir.
Beats killing arrogant SIS agents.
Better than the alternative.
Just barely.
Don't know that I'll ever trust the brass again. But I trust you, sir.
You kept me from making the biggest mistake of my life. I won't forget that.
Sir, about what happened earlier....
Zane got what was coming to him. But I shouldn't have been the one to pull the trigger.
Killing an unarmed man, a Republic agent no less... that goes against everything I've been raised to do. Everything I've been trained to do.
You did what had to be done.
It was necessary.
If killing Zane saves even a few Republic soldiers, I'll accept that burden. But that doesn't make it right.
You're a sniper. Taking down enemies is what you do.
You were trained to kill.
Sniping a target during an approved op is one thing. What happened back there was completely different.
None of the Deadeyes are going to say anything, if that's what you're worried about.
No one will ever know.
It's not that. I know they'll keep their word.
Honestly, it's not even Zane's death that's bothering me. It's everything--the Deadeyes, the operation and the Republic's part in all this.
You heard Zane. Thousands of soldiers, all being fed to the Empire to find a place that may not even exist. It isn't right.
The Republic sees us as expendable.
I agree.
We put a stop to that when we killed Zane.
We ended that.
Did we? Who's to say another agent won't just pick up right where he left off?
Zane seemed pretty sure Dusk 9 was real.
I'm sure it exists.
That's not the point. Real or rumor, it doesn't matter.
We're stats to the brass, numbers to throw at the Empire for the Republic's convenience.
I'd have been proud to die for the Republic before, but after this....
The actions of one man don't reflect the actions of the Republic as a whole.
Don't let this bring you down.
Zane may have just been one man, but there are plenty of others like him calling the shots for us.
You're still a part of this squad.
Don't quit on me.
Don't worry. I'm not throwing in the towel yet.
You're starting to sound like Tavus.
Are you defecting?
When Tavus defected, he turned his back on the very people he was sworn to protect. I'm nothing like him.
Won't ever trust Command again--but I'll keep fighting. Because the Republic is more than the bureaucrats running it.
It's the billions of people who can't fend for themselves, who are counting on us to defend them. I'll fight for them. And for you, sir.
Outstanding news, sir. We've got a positive fix on the Deadeyes' location.
Garza's people just finished decrypting the coordinates we sent them.
Balkar finally came through for us. Decrypted the rest of those coordinates we sent him.
Took them long enough, but my sources finally got the rest of those coordinates decrypted.
The data points to an Imperial outpost on Hoth. Another labor camp, most likely.
Let's get down there and bring those soldiers home.
What are we waiting for?
First Tatooine, now Hoth... the Imperials must really have it out for the Deadeyes.
Hoth? Ouch.
Picking off a few dozen Imperial officers will do that.
A friendly visit from Havoc Squad ought to settle the score.
Payback time.
Right behind you, sir.
Once we get those men out of there, we can put all this craziness behind us. I just hope we're not too late.
Just got off the holo with Torve. He asked me to thank you for getting him out of that labor camp.
He's starting to see the danger the other Deadeyes are in. Anxious for us to find them.
We could use him when we rescue the rest of the Deadeyes.
He should help us.
SIS already has him tied up in debriefs. Pretty much exchanged one cell for another.
Any luck decoding the rest of those coordinates?
How's the search going?
Still waiting. Shouldn't be long now.
He ought to be demoted for taking on a dangerous mission like that.
He really messed up.
As opposed to taking them on... a safe mission? We're not getting paid to deliver cookies, here.
It was a mistake to trust a snake like Zane, but Torve's heart was in the right place.
I just hope this mistake doesn't get any of those men killed.
Attention all Havoc personnel. I'm instating some mandatory downtime, effective immediately. So... get out, have fun. That's an order.
Attention all Havoc personnel. The colonel is instating some mandatory downtime, effective immediately. So... get out, have fun. That's an order.
Attention all Havoc personnel. The major is instating some mandatory downtime, effective immediately. So... get out, have fun. That's an order.
Attention all Havoc personnel. The captain is instating some mandatory downtime, effective immediately. So... get out, have fun. That's an order.
Attention all Havoc personnel. We're instating some mandatory downtime, effective immediately. So... get out, have fun. That's an order.
There. Thought a little R & R might do the squad some good.
I also figured a little alone time would do us some good.
Now that's the kind of initiative I like to see in a man.
Good thinking.
Yeah? Well, how's this for initiative?
You think we should "rest and relax" together?
What'd you have in mind?
Something like that.
Report to my quarters in five minutes. Bring your body armor.
Think you can handle me?
Ha... you're joking, right?
Well. That was... productive. Very relaxing.
I'll have to schedule more R & R time for the squad. A lot more.
Have Elara schedule more R & R time for the squad. A lot more.
I may have been wrong about you.
Takes a lot to lead a squad like Havoc. Wasn't convinced you had it in you. Thought you were inexperienced, untested.
But you've got good instincts. Turned out to be a first-class leader.
That means a lot coming from you, Jorgan.
Thank you.
I just call it like I see it.
Wait, let me record this. I need proof.
This is a historic moment.
Let's not make a big deal out of this.
When you're right, you're right.
Obviously.
Don't let it go to your head.
I'll admit, that business on Ord Mantell still irks me.
But it landed me in the most elite squad in the Republic, under one of the finest commanders I've served with. So I can't complain too much.
You wanted to talk?
I did.
You're my commanding officer. When we're on the field, I'm supposed to be following your lead and watching your back.
I'm watching your back, all right... and everything else, too. It's... unprofessional.
I didn't realize I looked so good in uniform.
I'm flattered.
I didn't think it was possible to make thirty-two kilos of reinforced durasteel look good. But you manage.
You're a man, Jorgan. I'd be offended if you weren't sneaking an occasional peek.
Oh, get over it.
I'd like to do more than just peek.
As long as it doesn't affect your combat performance, stare away.
Don't let it become a problem.
Just keep that armor intact and we won't have a problem.
Look, I don't know if this thing between us is going anywhere. You're a remarkable woman--but you're still my CO.
I ever cross a line, go too far, you let me know.
If you've got something to say, then say it.
Don't hide behind your career.
Fine.
Just shut up and kiss me.
You haven't gone far enough.
Yes, sir.
What you do need is a woman who can put up with you.
You're hopeless. [Kiss him]
Whew. For the record, you kiss like most people punch.
Well. I think I've said my piece. We'll talk again. Soon.
I ever tell you about the time we were ordered to take out Moff Dalom? Dangerous mark. Wily as a--hang on.
Incoming transmission. Care to guess who it is?
Major. Senior Agent Zane, here. Apparently, I didn't make myself clear earlier.
Captain. Senior Agent Zane, here. Apparently, I didn't make myself clear last time.
Senior Agent Zane, here. Apparently, I didn't make myself clear earlier.
Or perhaps you thought an unauthorized rescue mission wouldn't constitute as "interfering"?
We knew exactly what we were doing.
No misunderstanding here.
Thought so.
Can it, Zane. Torve told us all about your involvement in the Deadeyes' capture.
We're on to you.
Considering how incredibly classified that information was, I do hope you had to torture Lieutenant Torve.
I've got the other Deadeyes to rescue, so if you don't mind....
I don't have time for this.
This'll only take a moment.
I understand you're concerned for your comrades, but you morons are only complicating things.
You're addressing the commander of Havoc Squad, Zane. You will show him the proper respect.
You're addressing the commander of Havoc Squad, Zane. You will show her the proper respect.
Apologies. But this is a delicate operation and your continued involvement will only jeopardize its completion.
We could've worked together if you'd kept us in the loop.
You held out on me.
I would have if this had been any of your business.
You know where the other Deadeyes are being held. Tell me.
Where are the others?
Seems to have slipped my mind.
You can expect a lot more interference from us in the future.
Too bad.
Then you can expect far worse than holocalls.
Your operation's falling apart, Zane. Now either rescue the Deadeyes yourself or get out of our way.
I don't take orders from grunts. This mission is over when I say it is.
I've had it with this guy. Permission to cut him off, sir.
Permission granted.
Please do.
I'd rather do it myself.
Allow me.
By all means.
Good riddance.
Stay out of this.
Permission denied.
No more warnings. I so much as smell you again, and I'll deal with you. Personally.
I can't tell if he really dropped the ball on this one or if he's still just lying to us.
Either way, the SIS had their chance. Time for Havoc Squad to get the job done right.
Good news, sir. Balkar finally decoded that first set of coordinates.
Good news, sir. Garza's people decoded the first portion of those coordinates.
Finally heard back from my sources. They got the first part of those coordinates decoded.
The data points to an Imperial excavation site on Tatooine. Looks like my former XO, Torve, is being held there.
The data points to an Imperial excavation site right here on Tatooine. Looks like my former XO, Torve, is being held there.
Then let's load up and get them out of there.
Let's go get 'em.
Ready when you are, sir.
Why are the Imperials taking prisoners to such a remote location?
Why Tatooine?
We knew the Imps were anxious to work the Deadeyes to death. Can't think of a harsher, more miserable place than Tatooine.
We'll know more once we find Torve. He just better have some answers for us.
Zane made it pretty clear that he doesn't want us interfering.
We shouldn't get involved.
You'd let good men die because some spook says so?
A real soldier would never leave a comrade behind. But it's your call, sir.
Still no word on the Deadeyes' location.
I checked with Garza, but she hasn't had any luck decrypting those coordinates we sent her.
Balkar hasn't had any success decrypting those coordinates we picked up.
Can't find a slicer good enough to decrypt those coordinates we found.
This is taking too long. For all we know, the Imperials have relocated the Deadeyes. That intel could be obsolete.
We can still pick up a new trail if we follow those coordinates.
Then we'll keep on searching.
I suppose you're right.
Now you're just trying to be pessimistic.
Quit worrying.
I prefer to think of it as preemptive disappointment.
We don't even know if the Deadeyes are still alive.
They could be dead.
Way to keep up morale.
I'll keep monitoring the holo. Maybe something will turn up.
I never properly congratulated you on your promotion. You've come a long way since Ord Mantell. We should celebrate.
Aric Jorgan--celebrating? I thought you were only interested in barking orders and sniping Imperials.
This isn't like you....
You thought wrong. Give me some Rodian ale when I'm off duty and--well, the Deadeyes could tell you a few stories.
You could make me dinner.
[Flirt] Can you cook?
You wouldn't enjoy that. I spent the last ten years living off field rations.
We don't have time for celebrations. We've got a war to fight.
No, we shouldn't.
I'm sure we can spare ten seconds.
I got you a little something....
Bought the stone off a trader a few years back. Had a Theelin jeweler fit it for me. Thought it'd look nice on you.
It's beautiful. Thank you.
I love it.
Anytime.
Maybe next time you can get me something more practical. Like thermite.
[Flirt] It's kinda girlie....
Oh? And what makes you think there's going to be a next time?
I should get back to my duties. Congratulations again, sir.
I'm your commanding officer, Jorgan. Getting me gifts is unprofessional.
That's not appropriate.
Right. Won't happen again, sir.
Well, the search is officially underway. I transmitted those coordinates we picked up to Balkar's contact in SigInt.
Won't be long before we find out where the Deadeyes are--well, look at that.
That you, Gav?
You know, you really ought to start encrypting your communications. Finding your frequency was child's play.
You're crossing the line, Zane. Stay out of our business.
You've gone too far.
I was about to say the same to you.
You've got five seconds to explain yourself.
What do you want?
Your contact looks just like that nosy agent we met before. Weird.
He seems familiar....
Enough games.
I'll just leave you with a friendly suggestion: walk away.
That smug--! Why is he so interested in the Deadeyes?
In any case, he knows about Balkar's contact at SigInt. We'll have to find someone else to decrypt those coordinates.
I'd like to see Zane outmaneuver General Garza.
How about Garza?
Now you're talking. I'll bring the general up now.
This is General Garza. What can I do for you, Havoc?
We've got a problem, General....
Hmm. I don't like you going off mission, Colonel. Then again, I don't like SIS snoops meddling in military affairs, either.
Hmm. I don't like you going off mission, Major. Then again, I don't like SIS snoops meddling in military affairs, either.
Hmm. I don't like you going off mission, Captain. Then again, I don't like SIS snoops meddling in military affairs, either.
Hmm. I don't like you going off mission. Then again, I don't like SIS snoops meddling in military affairs, either.
Send me the coordinates. I'll get our people working on them right away. Just don't let this interfere with your mission.
We won't forget this, General.
Thank you.
You heard the general.
Get on that, Jorgan.
Transmitting the coordinates now, General.
Any chance of getting an ETA on those coordinates?
Will this take long?
They'll be ready when they're ready.
I'll let you know if we learn anything. Garza out.
There. If Zane manages to one-up Garza, I'll eat my rifle.
Balkar will know what to do. Let's get ahold of him.
Let's try Balkar again.
Fine. I'll put in the call.
Balkar. This is Lieutenant Jorgan, with Havoc Squad. You read me?
Balkar. This is Sergeant Jorgan, with Havoc Squad. You read me?
Loud and clear, Havoc. What is it now?
Zane's trying to stop us from decrypting those coordinates. We need your help.
Are you trying to get me suspended? Fired? Maybe arrested?
Yes or no, Balkar.
Fine. Send me the coordinates.
I'll make a few calls, cash in a few favors. It'll take time, but I'll get those coordinates decrypted.
We appreciate this, Balkar.
Thank you.
You owe me.
You're lucky I can't say "no" to a pretty face.
Make sure no one knows what you're up to. Especially Zane.
Be discreet.
Hey, it's me.
Be quick about it, Balkar.
Then get to it.
Discretion takes time.
I'll contact you as soon as I learn anything. Balkar out.
Let's hope he's half as good as he thinks he is.
Do what you have to do. Just don't bother me with it.
Figure it out.
Fine. I'll handle it.
Sir. I'm not very good at this, but... thank you. For the XO spot.
My career took a big hit when Tavus defected. I wasn't sure it'd ever recover.
You've proven yourself plenty of times on the field, Jorgan. You earned that promotion.
You deserve the XO spot.
Thank you, sir.
This should help you get back on track.
It was only fair.
It's a step.
I'm putting a lot of trust in you, Jorgan.
Don't let me down.
I won't let you down, sir.
I'll make sure Havoc stays the top squad in the Republic. You can count on it.
Permission to speak freely, sir.
Permission granted.
Let's hear it.
This should be good.
Oh, brother.
Dorne's a fine soldier, but... come on. We both know that XO position had my name all over it.
Why would you sabotage my career even further? Is it personal? Or did you just forget I used to be a lieutenant?
This isn't about you. Elara just has more of what I'm looking for in an XO.
It's nothing personal.
It's my call and you will abide by it, soldier.
That's enough!
The operative words being "used to."
And now you're not.
Still won't let that go, huh?
Fine. You can't see officer material when it's right in front of you, that's your business. Sir.
Permission denied. As you were, soldier.
No.
Sir.
Got a problem, sir. Weapons malfunction.
Had a couple misfires during that prison run. Think the barrel may be out of whack.
Not surprising, given all the action we've seen. With your permission, I'd like to inspect the rest of the squad's ordnance, make sure everything's up to code.
Way to think ahead, Jorgan.
Good idea.
That's what I do.
Go for it. You seem to know what you're doing.
If you think it's necessary.
I ought to, after all these years.
Looking for an excuse to go through my personal effects, are we?
[Flirt] Including mine?
Maybe. There something you don't want me to find?
I've got a few things in my wardrobe that aren't exactly regulation.
[Flirt] You could say that.
What you wear while you're off duty isn't any of my business, sir--unless you make it my business.
A woman's got to have some secrets.
[Flirt] I'm not telling.
You're certainly welcome to try. Cathar don't miss much. Snipers miss even less.
You don't need to bother me with every little detail.
Do you really have to ask?
Weapon maintenance is serious business.
When you're sniping enemies from eight hundred meters, any imperfection in the blaster can ruin your shot.
You hit targets from that far? You're good.
Eight hundred meters? Nice.
Part of the job, sir.
All the more reason for you to make sure our equipment is in optimal condition.
Then get to it.
Couldn't agree more.
Trying to impress me with your legendary sniping skills?
[Flirt] You big show-off.
Maybe. Is it working?
Make it a thousand meters and we'll talk.
[Flirt] Almost.
A thousand? You are one demanding CO.
If I didn't know any better, Jorgan, I'd say you were flirting.
You like me, don't you?
It's possible, sir. Just don't tell Elara. She'd probably write me up.
It'll take more than that to get me excited, hotshot.
[Flirt] Not exactly.
Hmm. Good to know.
Well, those weapons aren't going to inspect themselves. Sir.
I get it, you're an amazing shot. Now go clean those guns.
Quit bragging.
Ah--right.
No sign of them here. Balkar must've sent us on a wild--wait. I may have something.
It's an outgoing holomessage. Recent.
This is Captain Titch, confirming the details for outgoing prisoner transfer 993-B.
We've got three Gamorrean trespassers, a couple spice peddlers and our catch of the day--the legendary Deadeyes.
At least we know they're alive.
That's them.
Or were at the time of this transmission.
Looks like the Imperials already moved them.
We're too late.
Question is, where?
All that work just to find out they're not even here?
Well, that was a waste.
It'll be worth it if we can figure out where the Imperials shipped them off to.
As per protocol, we've split the Deadeyes up and transferred them to offworld labor camps.
I've encrypted the coordinates for their designated camps into this transmission. Those scum can spend their remaining years working off their debt.
Message ends there. Guess the Imps don't make things quick for their POWs. Lucky us.
That doesn't mean we have time to waste.
We'd still better hurry.
Agreed. I'll download those coordinates ASAP.
Make a copy of those coordinates.
Grab that data.
On it.
I'd be more grateful if the Deadeyes were still here.
Labor camps?
We'll just have to settle for swiping these coordinates.
Hmm. The encryption here is good. Too good.
I can't crack it. Looks like we may need Balkar's services again.
Bad news, sir.
I just received a dispatch from Command. It's my old sniper squad, the Deadeyes--they've been captured.
Happened during a routine officer hunt. Somehow the Imps got the drop on them, rounded up the entire unit. Careless.
Would it kill you to show a little sympathy?
You're so unforgiving.
Sorry, sir. Hugs all around next time I see them.
How long have the Deadeyes been in Imperial custody?
When did this happen?
Weeks. More than enough time to be marched in front of a firing squad.
First Tavus and the others go rogue, then the Deadeyes get captured--you're jinxed.
You're bad luck.
Right. Somehow it's all my fault.
Look, something about all this doesn't sit right with me.
The Deadeyes' area of operation was on Nar Shaddaa. That's Hutt territory, neutral ground. They shouldn't have had any business operating there.
The Deadeyes' area of operation was right here on Nar Shaddaa. This is Hutt territory, neutral ground. They shouldn't have had any business operating here.
I'm sure they had a good reason.
It must have been important.
The Republic would never risk a falling out with the Hutts just to bag a few Imperials.
You think there's more going on here?
You suspect something?
Can't say yet.
What if the Deadeyes defected, and their capture is just a cover-up?
Maybe they've gone rogue.
I trained those men myself, sir.
I need to know what happened to the Deadeyes--and if they're still alive.
Missions on Nar Shaddaa are usually green-lit by the SIS. With your permission, I'd like to meet with them, see what they know.
Get ahold of Jonas Balkar. He may be able to help us.
We know someone in the SIS.
Your call.
Sounds as good a place to start as any. Make it happen.
Sounds like a plan.
I'll contact that agent we dealt with last time. The annoying one... Balkar.
We'll rendezvous at that dive he hangs out in. With any luck, he'll have something for us.
We have our mission, Jorgan, and these Deadeyes of yours aren't part of it.
We don't have time for this.
At least let me contact that agent we dealt with last time. The annoying one... Balkar.
I'll tell him to wait for us at that dive he likes so much. You change your mind, great.
Sir, you should know... General Vander contacted me.
Said he'd talked it over with the brass and finagled a way to get me back on Ord Mantell.
Offered me my old post, a promotion and command of their operations there. Pretty sweet deal, overall.
I hope you turned him down. You're a part of Havoc Squad now.
I'd hate to see you leave.
You think I'd head back to some backwater planet like Ord Mantell?
Did you accept?
What did you say?
Of course not.
Please tell me you said "yes."
So I'm free of you?
Afraid you're still stuck with me.
Fact is, I've been hitting the Empire harder than ever since I joined Havoc Squad.
I didn't enlist to win medals or promotions. I enlisted to protect the Republic, to prove my people have a place here.
Glad you're finally warming up to your assignment.
That's great, Jorgan.
It's growing on me.
The Cathar will always have a place in the Republic.
Of course they belong here.
I hope so.
We already lost one home to the Mandalorians. I'm not about to let the Empire take another.
The squad comes first. Everything else comes second.
Get your priorities straight.
I know where my loyalties lie, sir. You've got nothing to worry about.
Inventory report, sir. Food and medical supplies all look good, but our munitions are getting low.
Thought we'd have enough to last us the year. Already requisitioned Command for more.
Guess I shouldn't be too surprised. See more action in one day with Havoc than you see in a month with the Deadeyes.
There's a lot of demand for a unit of our caliber.
We've been busy.
What kind of work did you do for the Deadeyes?
Why's that?
So, what, you just sat around all the time?
Why, were you lazy?
Kind of.
We mainly ran decapitation strikes, neutralized enemy commanders before a Republic offensive. Left the opposition leaderless, disorganized.
Sometimes we'd camp outside the enemy's base for weeks, waiting for a clear shot. Eventually we'd hit our target, pull out and let the ground pounders mop up.
You must've chalked up quite a kill count.
Sounds like you were busy.
Over two dozen confirmed.
Doesn't sound like the most honorable profession.
That's... really underhanded.
Can't say there's anything particularly noble about killing a man from half a klick.
I prefer being on the front lines, where the action is.
Sounds boring.
The sniper's life isn't for everyone. All about that one shot that'll make or break a battle.
Eventually, I was offered a promotion and a post on Ord Mantell. I took it.
Smart move, career-wise. More men, more responsibility. But I wasn't interested in fighting separatists.
What were you interested in?
Why not?
I signed on to fight Imperials. Anything else I did was career dressing.
Must've been an awkward transition.
That's quite a change.
One day I'm picking off Imperial brass, the next I'm pacifying mobs of angry seps.
You'll complain about anything.
You're never satisfied.
I enlisted for a lot of reasons. Killing seps wasn't one of them.
After my transfer, command of the Deadeyes fell to my XO, Torve. Smart kid--a little green, but the potential was there.
If he learned from you, I'm sure he's a fine officer.
He had a good teacher.
Only so much a person can be taught about leadership. You've either got what it takes, or you don't.
You weren't sure I was fit to lead, and look how I turned out.
You thought I was green, too.
Point taken, sir.
I'm sure they prefer him over the hard-nosed CO they used to have.
I doubt you're missed.
At least I got them home every mission. Can't expect much more from an officer.
Come to think of it, I haven't been in contact with the Deadeyes for awhile. I should find out where they're stationed, catch up.
So, that Forex is... interesting. Eager, but won't shut up. Kept going on about his "superior Republic engineering."
Finally called him on it, ran a weapons diagnostic. Loudmouth's packing some serious ordnance.
Sir. Had a brief chat with Dorne. Interesting woman.
A little too obsessed with regulations, but her knowledge of Imperial military protocol is invaluable.
Guess Havoc is finally shaping into a real squad.
You haven't seen anything yet.
This is only the beginning.
You're implying it wasn't before?
What's that supposed to mean?
We're rebuilding this unit from scratch. Wasn't exactly a "squad" back when it was just you and me.
About time we found some real soldiers.
No thanks to you.
Hey. I earned the Havoc stripes, same as everyone else here.
Just remember, people's expectations of us--of you--are only gonna get bigger.
So. Looks like it's still just the two of us. A lieutenant and his sergeant.
You think Havoc will start shaping into an actual squad soon?
I'll recruit more soldiers as soon as I find some Havoc-worthy candidates.
I only accept the best.
Makes sense.
You're saying it isn't now?
What are you implying?
Two people isn't a squad, sir. It's just... two people.
I hope so. Need to get some real soldiers in this unit.
Yeah, no thanks to you.
I earned the Havoc stripes, same as you.
Once this unit starts growing, people's expectations of us--of you--are only gonna get bigger.
That CO post could get real heavy, real quick.
I was born to lead.
I love this job.
Enjoy it while you can.
Someone needs to run Havoc Squad.
I'll take on that burden.
At least I get to boss you around.
It still has its perks.
I hope you're taking this seriously, sir.
Commanding a squad is no cakewalk. Nothing worse than having to choose between the success of the mission and the lives of your men.
That said, a leader can't be soft on his troops. Coddling your men will only get them killed.
A leader who's too headstrong, too eager to get the job done, will only end up getting his unit killed. Remember that.
A leader's got to be ready to make those kinds of life-or-death decisions. There's no room for doubt.
You've got a point. I'll keep it in mind.
That's good advice.
Jorgan? I got it.
I know what I'm doing.
Okay, I'll shut up.
I'm sure you'll do fine. You've gotten us this far.
When did Command put you in charge of Havoc? Oh, right--they didn't.
Who's running this unit?
Real mature.
I reviewed your service record before that ZR-57 op. Been meaning to discuss it with you.
You made quite an impression at the Academy: accelerated training programs, instructor recommendations. Graduated top of your class.
Heck of a transcript, but a classroom's no substitute for field experience.
Says you served in the Outer Rim. Knew a lot of good men who fought out there. Heard it was brutal.
Warfare like that can change a person, make them reckless. Unstable.
Says you've been fighting the Empire since you were old enough to hold a blaster. Ran quite the underground resistance.
So you can kill Imperials; but a guerilla mentality won't cut it in the big time.
You saw how I handled things on Ord Mantell. I know what I'm doing.
I can handle myself.
Taking on that sep army single-handedly showed guts, not leadership.
Why were you looking through my record?
You were snooping on me?
I like to know who I'm serving with. Especially if they're giving the orders.
When I signed on with the Deadeyes, my CO was Lieutenant Vorne--certified war hero, as decorated as they come.
When he gave an order, we trusted it, followed it to the letter. A squad needs that kind of commitment to operate effectively.
I expect you to give me that same level of dedication.
Then do what I say.
I always give a hundred percent. That's not the issue.
You're saying you don't trust me?
What are you implying?
I'm saying trust requires more than a slick new promotion.
Does a squad need annoying know-it-alls to operate effectively?
I didn't ask for a lecture.
I realize this is all textbook. But humor me.
Havoc Squad is the Republic's most elite outfit. We tackle the missions no one else can handle.
Traitor or no, Tavus is a tough act to follow. You think you're up to it?
I wouldn't be leading Havoc Squad if I didn't.
You bet.
Hmm. Good answer.
My record speaks for itself.
I've got nothing to prove.
I'll admit, you've seen and done more than most soldiers your age.
You've got confidence, and plenty of raw talent. Maybe you'll pull this off.
General Vander thought I was qualified for the job. That should be good enough for you.
Drop it.
I'm not questioning your ability.
Just remember what happened to me when things went south. You get in over your head, they'll do the same to you.
Skip the lecture and do something useful--like inventorying our munitions.
Quit wasting my time.
I was just--yes, sir.
Look, I can accept that you outrank me.
But for this to work, I need to know you still respect me. As an equal.
Of course I respect you, Jorgan.
You know I do.
Then start acting like it.
Why would you think I don't respect you?
What brought this up?
The way you've been acting lately, I'd never know.
But hey, you say you do, I'll take your word for it.
I'm your commanding officer. We're not equals.
I don't.
So that's how it is, huh? I'm just your subordinate? You're a real piece of work.
I'd heard getting involved with a superior officer was trouble. Now I finally get it.
You, me, the squad... it's all getting jumbled. Afraid to speak my mind. Half-expect you to pull rank on me if I say something you don't like.
We're used to beating the odds. We can make this work.
Don't give up on me.
This isn't some battlefield.
But if you're willing to tough it out, I can give it another shot, too.
As long as you're under my command, I have to treat you the same as everybody else.
It's my job.
That's fine when we're on the field, but when it's just us, it's... weird.
You better think long and hard how you want me to treat you--as my CO or as... something else.
I don't have time for this.
We can talk about this another time. You're dismissed, Captain.
We can talk about this another time. You're dismissed, Lieutenant.
We can talk about this another time. You're dismissed, Sergeant.
This is exactly what I'm talking about!
It's over. You, me--it's just not a solid fit.
We're creating tension in the ranks, putting the squad at risk. I can't have that.
It was fun while it lasted.
I understand.
If you say so.
As your commanding officer, I order you to stay with me.
It's over when I say it is.
There are some things you can't order me to do. This is one of them.
Let's just try and keep things professional from now on.
Fine by me--I don't want to get involved with a subordinate anyway.
See if I care.
Then everyone's a winner.
I hope you know what you're doing.
Some of your command decisions lately have been a little... unconventional. A few nearly got us killed.
You're right, Jorgan. I'll try to be more careful in the future.
You make a good point.
That's all I ask.
Sometimes you've got to take a few risks to get the mission done right.
Danger is part of the job.
There's risks and then there's stupid risks. Sir.
As long as you're a part of this unit, you'll do what I say.
Too bad.
May not be a unit if you keep this up.
You think this is a game? Some training exercise?
It's not. People's lives are on the line here, and unless you start doing your job, you're going to get those people killed.
If you have any suggestions, I'd be glad to hear them.
I'll do better.
Show some respect.
You're free to speak your mind, Captain, but you will address a superior officer properly.
You're free to speak your mind, Lieutenant, but you will address a superior officer properly.
You're free to speak your mind, Sergeant, but you will address a superior officer properly.
No disrespect intended, sir.
Just--just get us through this war in one piece, okay?
How I operate this unit is my call. Not yours.
Stand down!
Believe me, sir, I know.
That's it. I've had it.
I can't serve with you anymore. I'm putting in a transfer request first chance I get.
Sorry to see you go, Jorgan.
That's too bad.
I'm sure we can talk this over, work something out.
You don't have to go.
We're way beyond that point, sir.
You've been jealous of me from the start.
I knew you'd cut and run.
If that's what you want to believe, fine. I'm through trying to reason with you.
I'll continue my duties, if only to make sure you don't get the others killed.
But once this is all over, I'm gone.
I'm busy, sir. We'll talk later.
I'd like a word with you when we get back to the ship.
I need to talk to you. In private.
I'm not seeing them anywhere. Let's check the central computer.
Nothing here. Let's keep looking.
They're not on this cell block. Let's move on to the next.
Sir.
You need something?
There have to be better ways to waste our time, sir.
I'm sure you'll do fine. You've gotten us this far.
You're the boss.
I'm here.
Guess it's off to work, then. I'll watch our backs.
On it.
I won't let you down, sir.
Fine. I'll handle it.
Ready when you are, sir.
I just call it like I see it.
Right behind you, sir.
Ready to move when you are.
Right with you, boss.
